about.description:
diffoscope will try to get to the bottom of what makes files or directories
different. It will recursively unpack archives of many kinds and transform
various binary formats into more human readable form to compare them. It can
compare two tarballs, ISO images, or PDF just as easily.
about.summary: in-depth comparison of files, archives, and directories

name: diffoscope-all-tools
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.22.0
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: diffoscope-all-tools
  version: '227'
source:
  sha256: 0727b64dd78254e4e53beb2d2541b4f0933b601fa4ca34960d0c9abae5cbb6a9
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/d/diffoscope/diffoscope-227.tar.gz
build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  string: pyhd8ed1ab_0
requirements:
  host:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 2_gnu
    - bzip2 1.0.8 h7f98852_4
    - ca-certificates 2022.9.24 ha878542_0
    - ld_impl_linux-64 2.39 hc81fddc_0
    - libffi 3.4.2 h7f98852_5
    - libgcc-ng 12.2.0 h65d4601_19
    - libgomp 12.2.0 h65d4601_19
    - libnsl 2.0.0 h7f98852_0
    - libsqlite 3.40.0 h753d276_0
    - libuuid 2.32.1 h7f98852_1000
    - libzlib 1.2.13 h166bdaf_4
    - ncurses 6.3 h27087fc_1
    - openssl 3.0.7 h166bdaf_0
    - pip 22.3.1 pyhd8ed1ab_0
    - python 3.11.0 ha86cf86_0_cpython
    - readline 8.1.2 h0f457ee_0
    - setuptools 65.5.1 pyhd8ed1ab_0
    - tk 8.6.12 h27826a3_0
    - tzdata 2022f h191b570_0
    - wheel 0.38.4 pyhd8ed1ab_0
    - xz 5.2.6 h166bdaf_0
  run:
    - argcomplete
    - binutils
    - bzip2
    - cctools
    - defusedxml
    - diffoscope >=227,<228.0a0
    - docx2txt
    - e2fsprogs
    - ffmpeg
    - gettext
    - ghc
    - giflib
    - gnupg
    - h5py
    - hdf5
    - html2text
    - imagemagick
    - jsondiff
    - libdb
    - llvmdev
    - mono
    - ocaml
    - openjdk
    - openssh
    - pdfminer.six
    - poppler
    - postgresql
    - progressbar
    - pycryptodome
    - pypdf2 <1.28.0
    - python
    - python-debian
    - python-tlsh
    - r
    - rpm-tools
    - squashfs-tools
    - unzip
    - vim
    - wabt
    - zip
test:
  commands:
    - python -m pip check
    - diffoscope --list-missing-tools
    - "pytest -vv \\\n  --tb=long \\\n  --cov=diffoscope \\\n  --cov-report=term-missing\
      \ \\\n  --cov-report=term:skip-covered \\\n  --cov-fail-under=76 \\\n  --no-cov-on-fail\
      \ \\\n  -k=\"not ( \\\n    assert_non_existing or \\\n    test_berkeley_db or\
      \ \\\n    test_code_is_black_clean or \\\n    test_elf or \\\n    test_icc or\
      \ \\\n    test_item_rdb or \\\n    test_macho or \\\n    test_rlib or \\\n \
      \   test_wasm or \\\n    test_docx or \\\n    (test_pdf and test_no_differences)\
      \ or \\\n    (test_html and test_diff) \\\n  )\""
  requires:
    - file
    - pip
    - pytest
    - pytest-cov
  source_files:
    - tests
about:
  description: 'diffoscope will try to get to the bottom of what makes files or directories

    different. It will recursively unpack archives of many kinds and transform

    various binary formats into more human readable form to compare them. It can

    compare two tarballs, ISO images, or PDF just as easily.'
  dev_url: https://salsa.debian.org/reproducible-builds/diffoscope
  home: https://diffoscope.org
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: in-depth comparison of files, archives, and directories
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  feedstock-name: diffoscope
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - bollwyvl

about.description:
diffoscope will try to get to the bottom of what makes files or directories
different. It will recursively unpack archives of many kinds and transform
various binary formats into more human readable form to compare them. It can
compare two tarballs, ISO images, or PDF just as easily.
about.summary: in-depth comparison of files, archives, and directories

commands:
pytest -vv \
  --tb=long \
  --cov=diffoscope \
  --cov-report=term-missing \
  --cov-report=term:skip-covered \
  --cov-fail-under=76 \
  --no-cov-on-fail \
  -k="not ( \
    assert_non_existing or \
    test_berkeley_db or \
    test_code_is_black_clean or \
    test_elf or \
    test_icc or \
    test_item_rdb or \
    test_macho or \
    test_rlib or \
    test_wasm or \
    test_docx or \
    (test_pdf and test_no_differences) or \
    (test_html and test_diff) \
  )"
